text: Bomber shared by Tom at Zwanze Day 2016 - thanks! Pinkish orange pour, white head. Tart as F! Cherry, raspberry, some wood. Great!
Bomber shared at Zwanze day. Cloudy ruby red pour. Aroma is tart raspberry and cherries. Taste is exactly what you expect, in your face fruit tartness. Really good!
Sample at HMOG. Light fruit and tartness. Super crushable if it were easier to get! Really smooth and well done especially with the fruit component.

On tap at De garde. Pours out a cloudy deep pink topped with a small fizzy pink head. nose is big fruit notes cherries berries some oak and plenty tartness. taste is more of of the heavy fruit combo cherries berries and even a little lemon.

Bottle @ Mikes. Nice pink colored beer with a white head. Pretty funky cherry and fruit aromas. A nice bit of berry seeds and jam. Slight cherry pie filling and maybe even a touch of crust sweetness. Grass funkiness. Nice lemon tartness without being overly sour. A touch of grape and melon.

On tap at De Garde. Pours a hazy pink with small white head that quickly diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong berries, cherry skin, lacto, oak. Thin mouth, light salt, vinous, tart berry, crisp, very good.

Bottle shared by Matt - thanks man!@ Pours cloudy pink, small off-white head, dissipates quickly, some lacing. Aroma is super funky, cheesy, horse blankets, funky cherries and stems. Flavor is light tart and medium funk, cheese and cherries. Lightish body. Much more like a lambic than a gose, IMO>
Bottle. Pink hazy pour. Nice tart fruit, cherries, sour aromas. Nice cherries, tart fruit, sour aromas. Gose? Not sure.
Bottle - pours purple pink white head - nose and taste of sea salt, cherry, raspberry, cinnamon, oak and wine - medium body

750 ml bottle acquired from the brewery taproom (Tillamook, OR). Pours a deep reddish cranberry hue with firm hazinessn murky rich berry, red wine purple color. Firmer berry pulp, frothy pinkish head dies to a mellow layer, loose film and mellow ringer laces minimally after a potent firm slow gusher off the bat. Aromas show pulpy raspberry, tart cherries and a firmer lactic appeal. Earth, yogurt, firm potent acidity and rich red berry appeal meets a growing firm mineral seat salt appeal. Earthy, dry, salty element isnt rich off the bat but comes on well as we settle in. Initial is sour and deep, a firmer berry presence is spritzy, berry tinged and a touch tannic. A firmer lactic appeal is potent and sour, some firmer salty appeal grows with subtle straw, firmer pulpy seedy raspberry elements are fruity, deep and offer some tannic appeal. The cherryskin comes in, a touch tart and bitter with residual salty appeal. A firmer lactic presence actually gets a bit lost behind that richer berry fruit presence overall, adding some complexity and spin in its own right. That salty appeal covers up a more potent acidity into the back as well, again softening the acidity from that base lactic appeal. A firmer deep fruit addition and salty gose liveliness makes this much easier on the palate. Rich, fruity, tart with some salty appeal, earth and straw. Pleasant stuff. A fun flow and balance from all trhe elements.
Tap at brewery. Pours hazy bright pink with pink head. Aroma is strong berry, sweet cherries, citrusy, a big fruit bomb. Taste is light, high carb, tart, very fruit forward. Overall, yummmmm.
